Title: The Final Report on Early Case Consideration of the Steering Committee on Justice Efficiencies and Access to the Justice System - Part C. Bail/Remand
Biblio Annotation: Recommendations such as weekend bail courts, crown discretion, and bail supervision programs, dealing with delays and inefficiencies in bail system
Author(s): Standing Committee on Legal and Constitutional Affairs

Title: Shifting risk : Bail and the use of sureties
Biblio Annotation: Problematic risk assessment leading to more bail court appearances and more inmates

Title: The Parable of Ms Baker: Understanding Pre-Trial Detention in Canada
Biblio Annotation: Culture of risk aversion linked to growing remand population
Author(s): Cheryl Marie Webster, Anthony N. Doob, Nicole M. Myers

Title: Out of Sight, Out of Mind: A Case Study of Bail Efficiency in Video Remand
Biblio Annotation:
This study draws attention to the issue of bail court efficiency.

Video remand court, which was originally introduced to increase court efficiency, may actually be leading to additional delays.

Title: Explaining Inefficiency in an Ontario Bail Court: Perspectives of Criminal Defence Lawyers
Biblio Annotation: Paper argues that defence lawyers are not the primary reason why bail court cases are delayed

Title: A Case for Bail Reform
Biblio Annotation: Good explainer on why bail needs to be reformed in mass media

Title: Bail system a joke: Mandel
Biblio Annotation: Shows right wing - fear mongering view

Title: 16x9 - Before The Courts: Inside Canada's bail system - YouTube
Biblio Annotation: Short documentary on the police's perspective on the bail system and their efforts to make sure that people obey their release conditions.

Title: Bail Experts Table Recommendations
Biblio Annotation: Recommendations to reform Ontario's bail system by a panel of stakeholders and experts
Parent Org: Ontario Ministry of the Attorney General

Title: Creating Criminality: The Intensification of Institutional Risk Aversion Strategies and the Decline of the Bail Process
Biblio Annotation: Institutional risk aversion, denial of bail, onerous conditions

Title: Reasonable Bail?
Biblio Annotation: New recommendations on enhancing language on ladder approach for crowns; police to release more; in addition to Steering Committee findings

Title: Segregation and mental health in Ontario’s prisons: Jahn v. Ministry of Community Safety and Correctional Services
Biblio Annotation: As the result of the Jahn settlement, the Ministry of Community Safety and Correctional Services is to review how to best serve women inmates with mental illness, put in place mental health screening for all inmates, ensure people who need treatment plans and mental health services have access to them,  and train front line staff and managers on mental health issues and human rights obligations.

Title: The Application of Gladue to Bail: Problems, Challenges, and Potential
Biblio Annotation: The current bail crisis continues to disproportionately affect Aboriginal people, despite the sentencing principles set out by the Supreme Court of Canada in Gladue.

Title: Set Up to Fail: Bail and the Revolving Door of Pre-trial Detention
Biblio Annotation: Analyzes systematic issues with current bail system at each step of the process from detention to release.

Title: "Broken Bail" in Canada
Biblio Annotation: An overview of the seriousness of the bail crisis across Canada, with specific suggestions for a path forward, both in terms of a building a new bail regime from the ground up, or implementing improvements to the existing regime.

Title: Risk Aversion in the Bail Setting: An Examination of the Predictive Validity of an Ontario Bail Supervision Program’s Risk Assessment Tool
Biblio Annotation: Analysis of an Ontario bail supervision's use of SPIn, a risk assessment tool, to predict bail supervision outcomes and the broader impact on cultural and systemic factors related to bail.

Title: Who said anything about justice? Bail court and the culture of adjournment
Biblio Annotation: Looking at observational data from a bail court in Ontario, it becomes apparent that a "culture of adjournment" dominates the court system when it comes to bail, where actors are focused more on moving through the daily docket than securing justice.
Parent Org: Canadian Journal of Law and Society

Title: Wrongful Pre-Trial Detention in the Toronto Bail System
Biblio Annotation: In examining 20 bail cases from the Greater Toronto Area where charges were later withdrawn or dismissed, many of the cases amount to miscarriages of justice, as bail hearing justices failed to meaningfully assess the strength of the Crown's position in relation to the case for detention.

Title: Rough justice: Lockdowns skyrocket at short-staffed Ontario jails
Biblio Annotation: Chronic staffing shortage at Ontario's jails means that programs are cancelled and lockdowns are regularly deployed as a tactic to remedy shortages in staffing. During lockdowns inmates can be shut in their cells for days.

Title: Unlocking Change - Decriminalizing Mental Health Issues
Biblio Annotation: Exploration of the social, human and fiscal costs tied to criminalization of mental issues, with a recommendation to emphasize prevention, integration, and de-stigmatization.
